summary: This is a Palm Beach Police Department incident report from the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It details an interview with Epstein's pilot, David Rodgers, regarding passenger manifests and flights, including a specific flight to pick up an individual. The report notes Rodgers's limited knowledge of passengers and his decision to consult an attorney.

keyFacts: David Rodgers, Jeffrey Epstein's pilot since 1991, was interviewed by Palm Beach police on February 13, 2006.
Rodgers stated that unless Epstein flew to his island off St. Thomas, there was 'no way of knowing who the passengers were' as he stayed in the cockpit.
Rodgers prepared passenger manifests listing Epstein and known assistants by name, but other passengers were listed only as 'female' or 'male' to keep a count.
The interview was cut short after Mrs. Rodgers recommended her husband consult with an attorney, and Rodgers agreed to do so.
The police report is part of Case No. 1-05-000368 and is subject to a protective order.
